title: Scenic, "Psyche Bringing Venus a Goblet of Water from the Fountain of Youth", ca. 1820
provenance: 3-panel scene had been installed by a previous owner of donor Elizabeth Werter's Brooklyn, NY, apartment. Donor had the panels removed in May, 1998. Was offered to Cooper-Hewitt in December 2012.
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth Werter and Henry Trevor
description: One scene from the twelve which illustrate the story of Cupid and Psyche. This scene, containing three panels, shows a kneeling Psyche offering a goblet to a seated Venus. Cupid, leaning on his bow, stands on a pedestal in the background. The figures are within an Empire-style interior, with marble-tiled walls, columns, fountains, coffered ceiling and parquet floor. The entire scene is printed in grisaille, or shades of gray.

tombstone.epitaph: Scenic, "Psyche Bringing Venus a Goblet of Water from the Fountain of Youth", ca. 1820.Block-printed on handmade paper. Gift of Elizabeth Werter and Henry Trevor. 2013-9-1.
